titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. J. T. Whitlow & L. P. Pace, Transcript
CWG7164

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Metcalfe Circuit Court
June term 1865
Commonwealth Plff
vs
J T Whitlow & L P Pace Defts
Be it remembered that on the 5th day of June 1865 the plff. by her attorney filed in said her notice against the defts, as follows viz:

Notice
J T Whitlow and L P Pace, take notice, that whereas at the December term 1864 of the Metcalfe Circuit Court, a judgment was rendered in said Court, and entered of record against you in favor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, for one hundred dollars and costs upon a forfeited bail bond, and which said judgment is yet uncollected and the same was on or about the 15 day of March 1865 destroyed by fire; therefore you are hereby notified that I will on the first day of the June term 1865 of the Metcalfe Circuit Court, move said Court to execute said Judgment of Record
J H C Sandidge Atty for the Comth

Return
Said Notice was executed by the Sheriff of Metcalfe Count on L P Pace May 5 1865 and on J T Whitlow June 5th 1865.

On the same day, at a Circuit
Court commenced as aforesaid the following judgment was rendered herein

Judgt.
It appearing to the Court that the judgment heretofore rendered in this action against the defts. has been destroyed, and the deft Pace having been duly summoned and failing to answer, and the deft. Whitlow entered his appearance in Court, and the proof having been heard, it is adjudged by the Court that the Commonwealth recover of said defts $100. the amount of the original judgment, and the costs of the original action.
On motion of the defts their motion for a new trial, made at the last December term of the Court is reentered of record and said motion is continued till to tomorrow.
Afterwards at a Circuit Court court continued and held as above on the 6th day of June 1865 the following order was made herein viz

Order
The defts by their attorney produced grounds for a new trial herein, and the same is ordered to be filed
And afterwards at a Circuit Court Continued and held as above, the following order was made herein viz

Order
The motion for a new trial herein was heard by the court and over ruled, to which ruling of the Court the defts except,

State of Kentucky
Metcalfe Circuit Court Sct.

I R H Young clerk of the Metcalfe Circuit Court in the State of Kentucky do hereby certify that the foregoing is a full true and complete transcript of the case therein mentioned as fully as the same appears of record and on file in my office Given under my hand this 9th day of Oct. 1865.

Metcalfe Cir Ct
vs
Commonwealth
vs } Transcript
J T Whitlock &c
$100
Forfeiture
2nd Dec /65
For J T Whitlow
$1.00
